original_title: Former ‘Scream VII’ director discusses his ‘painful’ exit from the franchise | CNN
article_summary: Christopher Landon, director of "Happy Death Day" and "Freaky", left "Scream VII" in 2023 due to the departure of Melissa Barrera, following her controversial social media posts. Landon felt his project no longer existed after Barrera's exit, and he faced backlash as a perceived villain. He later focused on a new project, "Drop", and considers it the best decision of his career. "Scream VII" is now being directed by original scribe Kevin Williamson, with Neve Campbell and Courteney Cox returning.</s>
